nodes.name: project
nodes.description: Any specifically defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement. (NCIt C47885)

properties.name: availability_mechanism
properties.description: Mechanism by which the project will be made avilable.

properties.name: availability_type
properties.description: Is the project open or restricted?

properties.name: code
properties.description: Unique identifier for the project.

properties.name: complete
properties.description: Description of whether the project submission is complete or still in progress.

properties.name: date_collected
properties.description: The date or date range in which the project data was collected.

properties.name: dbgap_accession_number
properties.description: The dbgap accession number provided for the project.

properties.name: intended_release_date
properties.description: Tracks a Project's intended release date.

properties.name: investigator_affiliation
properties.description: The investigator's affiliation with respect to a research institution.

properties.name: investigator_name
properties.description: Name of the principal investigator for the project.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Display name/brief description for the project.

properties.name: releasable
properties.description: A project can only be released by the user when `releasable` is true.

properties.name: released
properties.description: To release a project is to tell the GDC to include all submitted entities in the next GDC index.

properties.name: support_source
properties.description: The name of source providing support/grant resources.

properties.name: support_id
properties.description: The ID of the source providing support/grant resources.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'project' table.

nodes.name: study
nodes.description: A coordinated set of actions and observations designed to generate data, with the ultimate goal of discovery or hypothesis testing.

properties.name: study_objective
properties.description: The general objective of the study. What the study hopes to discover or determine through testing.

properties.name: study_design
properties.description: Summary of the goals the study is designed to discover. General description of the study's place in relation to a clinical application.

properties.name: study_setup
properties.description: A high level description of the setup used to achieve the study objectives.

properties.name: associated_study
properties.description: The submitter_id for any study with which this study is associated, paired, or matched.

properties.name: data_description
properties.description: Brief description of the data being provided for this study. Free text

properties.name: study_description
properties.description: A brief description of the study being performed. Free text

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'project' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'study' table.

properties.name: study.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'study' table.

nodes.name: subject
nodes.description: The collection of all data related to a specific subject in the context of a specific project.

properties.name: lss
properties.description: Is the subject in the LSS cohort?

properties.name: inutero
properties.description: Is the subject in the Inutero cohort?

properties.name: f1
properties.description: Is the subject in the F1 cohort?

properties.name: ahs
properties.description: Is the subject in the AHS cohort?

properties.name: updt
properties.description: Last updated date

properties.name: lss_entry_dt
properties.description: Subject's date of entry into the LSS cohort

properties.name: lss_updt
properties.description: Last update of subject's LSS record

properties.name: inutero_entry_dt
properties.description: Date when the subject became a member of the Inutero cohort

properties.name: inutero_updt
properties.description: Last update of subject's Inutero record

properties.name: f1_entry_dt
properties.description: Date when the subject became a member of the F1 cohort

properties.name: f1_updt
properties.description: Last update of subject's F1 record

properties.name: ahs_updt
properties.description: Last update of subject's AHS record

properties.name: mfup_last_contact
properties.description: Mortality follow-up date of last contact

properties.name: death_dt
properties.description: Date of death of the subject

properties.name: death_updt
properties.description: Last update of the subject's death record

properties.name: death_icd_updt
properties.description: Last update of subject's death ICD record

properties.name: mfup_last_status
properties.description: Mortality follow-up last known status of the subject (1 - alive, 2 - dead, 3 - lost, etc)

properties.name: dose_expcity
properties.description: Subject's city of exposure  1 - Hiro, 2 - Naga

properties.name: dose_expstatus86
properties.description: Exposure status based on 1986 algorithm

properties.name: dose_expstatus02
properties.description: Exposure status based on 2002 algorithm

properties.name: dose_prish
properties.description: Subject's primary shield

properties.name: death_src
properties.description: Source of the information of subject's death (ex. Death certificate, etc.)

properties.name: dose_source
properties.description: What is the source of the exposure information?  Ex. Questionnaire

properties.name: sysid
properties.description: Globally unique identifier for subject

properties.name: city
properties.description: 1 = Hiro, 2 = Naga

properties.name: sex
properties.description: 1 = male

properties.name: lss_sample_class
properties.description: Subject's recruitment class into LSS cohort?

properties.name: lss_census
properties.description: Census info used for recruitment into LSS cohort?

properties.name: mother_sysid
properties.description: The globally unique identifier for the subject's mother

properties.name: father_sysid
properties.description: The globally unique identifier for the subject's father

properties.name: f1_sample
properties.description: Subject's recruitment class into F1 cohort?

properties.name: f1_ind
properties.description: Must = 1

properties.name: ahs_subgroup
properties.description: Subgroup to which the subject belongs.

properties.name: ahs_exp_category
properties.description: Exposure category?

properties.name: death_icd_rev
properties.description: ICD version

properties.name: death_icd_grp
properties.description: RERF-specific ICD grouping code

properties.name: dose_abscissa
properties.description: X coordinate of subject's position on exposure

properties.name: dose_ordinate
properties.description: Y coordinate of subject's position on exposure

properties.name: dose_gdist
properties.description: Subject's ground distance from explosion

properties.name: dose_shloc
properties.description: Shield location

properties.name: dose_ds02cal
properties.description: Calculated location?

properties.name: dose_ds02cat
properties.description: Calculation algorithm

properties.name: dose_calgroup02
properties.description: Calculation information

properties.name: kerma_fiau02g
properties.description: Overall dose (gamma radiation)

properties.description: Overall dose (neutron radiation)

nodes.name: sample
nodes.description: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Samples can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

properties.name: tissue_type
properties.description: Text term that represents a description of the kind of tissue collected with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue.

properties.name: preservation_method
properties.description: Text term that represents the method used to preserve the sample.

properties.name: method_of_sample_procurement
properties.description: The method used to procure the sample used to extract analyte(s).

properties.name: initial_weight
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the initial weight of the sample, measured in milligrams.

properties.name: freezing_method
properties.description: Text term that represents the method used for freezing the sample.

properties.name: days_to_collection
properties.description: Time interval from the date of biospecimen collection to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

properties.name: composition
properties.description: Text term that represents the cellular composition of the sample.

properties.name: biospecimen_laterality
properties.description: For tumors in paired organs, designates the side on which the specimen was obtained.

properties.name: biospecimen_anatomic_site
properties.description: Text term that represents the name of the primary disease site of the submitted tumor sample.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'sample' table.

properties.name: sysid
properties.description: A unique identifier for an individual person within a project. The 'sysid' key in RERF tables.

properties.name: sample.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'sample' table.

nodes.name: aliquot
nodes.description: A portion taken from a sample used for analysis, including analytes extracted from a sample.

properties.name: aliquot_container
properties.description: The device in which the final aliquot is held. Slides or vials.

properties.name: aliquot_quantity
properties.description: The quantity in micrograms (ug) of the aliquot(s) derived from the analyte(s) shipped for sequencing and characterization.

properties.name: aliquot_volume
properties.description: The volume in microliters (ml) of the aliquot(s) derived from the analyte(s) shipped for sequencing and characterization.

properties.name: analyte_a260_a280_ratio
properties.description: The ratio of absorbance at 260 and 280 nm for nucleic acid analytes.

properties.name: analyte_concentration
properties.description: Concentration of the analyte in the aliquot.

properties.name: analyte_isolation_method
properties.description: The name or general description of the method used to isolate the analyte.

properties.name: analyte_type
properties.description: Any aspect of an aliquot used in an analysis or assay to characterize the sample. These aspects range from molecules, such as DNA and RNA, that can be extracted from the aliquot to general descriptions of the aliquot's components, such as cell count and morphology.

properties.name: days_to_aliquot
properties.description: The amount of time, in days, between the date used for index and the time the aliquot was separated from the whole sample.

properties.name: hours_to_analyte
properties.description: The amount of time, in hours, that it took between the sample being fractionated and the analyte being extracted.

properties.name: hours_to_preservation
properties.description: The amount of time, in hours, that it took between the sample being fractionated and the aliquot being frozen or otherwise preserved.

properties.name: preservation_method
properties.description: The method used to preserve the aliquot.

properties.name: source_center
properties.description: Name of the center that provided the item.

properties.name: storage_temperature
properties.description: The temperature, in centigrade, at which the aliquot was preserved and/or stored.

properties.name: sysid
properties.description: Unique subject identifier

properties.name: sample.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'sample' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'aliquot' table.

properties.name: sysid
properties.description: Unique subject identifier

properties.name: aliquot.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'aliquot' table.

nodes.name: read_group
nodes.description: Sequencing reads from one lane of an NGS experiment.

properties.name: RIN
properties.description: A numerical assessment of the integrity of RNA based on the entire electrophoretic trace of the RNA sample including the presence or absence of degradation products.

properties.name: adapter_sequence
properties.description: Base sequence of the sequencing adapter.

properties.name: barcoding_applied
properties.description: True/False- was barcoding applied?

properties.name: coverage
properties.description: Sequencing coverage used in the assay (e.g., 75 PE).

properties.name: customization
properties.description: A description of any special setup or customization not documented elsewhere.

properties.name: cycles
properties.description: The number of cycles used in the assay (e.g., 50,000x per sample).

properties.name: flow_cell_barcode
properties.description: Flow cell barcode. Wrong or missing information may affect analysis results.

properties.name: instrument_model
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the sample dimension that is greater than the shortest dimension and less than the longest dimension, measured in millimeters.

properties.name: is_paired_end
properties.description: Are the reads paired end?

properties.name: library_name
properties.description: Name of the library.

properties.name: library_preparation_kit_catalog_number
properties.description: Catalog of Library Preparation Kit

properties.name: library_preparation_kit_name
properties.description: Name of Library Preparation Kit

properties.name: library_preparation_kit_vendor
properties.description: Vendor of Library Preparation Kit

properties.name: library_preparation_kit_version
properties.description: Version of Library Preparation Kit

properties.name: library_selection
properties.description: Library Selection Method

properties.name: library_strand
properties.description: Library stranded-ness.

properties.name: library_strategy
properties.description: Library strategy.

properties.name: platform
properties.description: Name of the platform used to obtain data.

properties.name: read_group_name
properties.description: The name given to this read group. Should match what is provided in the headers of associated files.

properties.name: read_length_lower
properties.description: The lower limit for the length of reads used in the sequencing experiment.

properties.name: read_length_upper
properties.description: The upper limit for the length of reads used in the sequencing experiment.

properties.name: sequencing_center
properties.description: Name of the center that provided the sequence files.

properties.name: target_capture_kit_catalog_number
properties.description: Catalog of Target Capture Kit.

properties.description: Name of Target Capture Kit.

properties.description: Vendor of Target Capture Kit.

properties.name: target_capture_kit_version
properties.description: Version of Target Capture Kit.

properties.name: universal_molecular_identifier
properties.description: Short sequences or barcodes added to each read for next generation sequencing protocols used to detect and quantify unique transcripts.

properties.name: aliquot.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'aliquot' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'read_group' table.

properties.description: The 128-bit hash value expressed as a 32 digit hexadecimal number (in lower case) used as a file's digital fingerprint.

properties.description: The GUID of the object in the index service.
